ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to craft research questions and design experiments to explore those questions. By conducting experiments, I was able to gain insight into a wide range of experimental techniques, including immunohistochemistry and confocal imaging.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: A big strength is the opportunity for us to write a summary paper at the end of the semester that truly allows us to reflect on our research experience and organize everything we have done in one place.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially if you are interested in pursuing a PhD and want to gain exposure to a lab environment.

It will come down to your own lab mentor and the lab environment. If they are supportive, this is definitely a good way to gain experience. Do not expect anything from the NSCI department, as they are not very connected with their students anyways.
